alert.note: Alert for Grant; Stanton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 7:59PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT GRANT AND EASTERN STANTON COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM CDT... At 758 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Johnson City to 8 miles southwest of Big Bow to 8 miles northeast of Richfield. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Big Bow around 805 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Ulysses and Hickok. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
